In the baseline implementation, what are key relationships between Change and Configuration Item (CI) records? (Choose three.)

A. The CI Manager is part of the change approval workflow (change manager)
B. One Change can be submitted for multiple CIs ( Tokyo pg no 333, 396)
C. Changes should reference at least one CI
D. The CI Support Group is responsible for change implementations (not as 408)
E. A CI can be affected by a change, even if it is not the CI being changed

Selected Answer: BCE
A is not true as the Change Manager and the Change Approval Workflow are involved in chang approvals, not the CI Manager. D is incoorect as the Implementation Team, not the CI Support Group is responsible for implementing the changes.

Selected Answer: BCE
The right answer should be BCE

Selected Answer: BCE
ITSM Implementation Tokyo eBook pg 333, 396, 408, 410

Selected Answer: BCE
Why B: One Change can be submitted for multiple CIs

You can add multiple CIs to once change request

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE correct

Selected Answer: ACE
ACE is correct
One change only for one CI.
Change group is responsible for change implementations.
I think this should be BCE. I dont think the CI Manager is an approval for baseline CMRs.

questions.question_text: In the baseline implementation, what are key relationships between Change and Configuration Item (CI) records? (Choose three.)

choices.A: The CI Manager is part of the change approval workflow
choices.E: A CI can be affected by a change, even if it is not the CI being changed
choices.B: One Change can be submitted for multiple CIs
choices.D: The CI Support Group is responsible for change implementations
choices.C: Changes should reference at least one CI

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
ITSM Implementation Tokyo eBook pg 389,398

Selected Answer: A

questions.question_text: In Change management, what allows customers to define condition based flows for a fit for purpose model?
By default, a business rule, causes the Assignment group to be automatically set. How is the group identified?

choices.D: Support group on CI record, or if empty, the Support group on the Service offering
choices.A: Change group on CI record, or if empty, the Change group on the Service offering
choices.B: Support group on CI record, or the default assignment group for the user
choices.C: Support group on CI record, or if empty, the Support group on the Service

discussion.content:
A is the correct one.
Support Group goes for Incident. For a change record, it is the change group. Source ITSM ebook.

Not submitting a Vote here, this is a bad question. The Table needs to be specified.

For Change Management the answer is A.

Selected Answer: C
Instance upgrading to Quebec or Rome from a Paris or older release:

will continue to use the Change Interceptor and types by default and will only have the legacy change
types visible. The instance properties will be set to:
com.snc.change_management.change_model.hide=true
com.snc.change_management.change_model.type_compatibility=true
A - definitely

A. 
From the book:
Before the Change > Create New module creates a new record in the Change Request [change_request] table, the change landing page is presented and prompts the user to select the change model the change request should follow. This was introduced in Quebec and replaces the legacy change interceptor.
A. Change Landing Page
A is correct.

Answer : A (given above)
